28namespace vsip
29{
30
31namespace impl
32{
33
34/// Enum to indicate data interface syncronization necessary for
35/// correctness.
36enum sync_action_type
37{
38  /// syncronize data interface on creation
39  SYNC_IN              = 0x01,
40  /// syncronize data interface on destruction
41  SYNC_OUT             = 0x02,
42  /// SYNC_INOUT syncronize data interface on creation and destruction
43  SYNC_INOUT           = SYNC_IN | SYNC_OUT,		// 0x03
44  SYNC_NOPRESERVE_impl = 0x04,
45  /// syncronize data interface on creation
46  /// with guarantee that changes are not preserved
47  /// (usually by forcing a copy).
48  SYNC_IN_NOPRESERVE   = SYNC_IN | SYNC_NOPRESERVE_impl	// 0x05
49};
50
51namespace data_access 
52{
53
54/// Low-level data access class.
55///
56/// Template parameters:
57///
58///   :AT: is a valid data access tag,
59///   :Block: is a block that supports the data access interface indicated
60///           by `AT`.
61///   :LP:    is a layout policy compatible with access tag `AT` and block 
62///           `Block`.
63///
64/// (Each specializtion may provide additional requirements).
65///
66/// Member Functions:
67///    ...
68///
69/// Notes:
70///   Low_level_data_access does not hold a block reference/pointer, it
71///   is provided to each member function by the caller.  This allows
72///   the caller to make policy decisions, such as reference counting.
73template <typename AT,
74          typename Block,
75	  typename LP>
76class Low_level_data_access;
77
78template <typename AT> struct Cost { static int const value = 10; };
79
80} // namespace vsip::impl::data_access
81} // namespace vsip::impl
82} // namespace vsip
